That is debatable.
Cultures have been influencing each other since the beginning of civilization.
topics.author: 4fde5cee945b700a970060fc

topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53641e856368722e915a0000#post_53641e856368722e915a0000
Pretty much.  There's a lot we could learn from the roman empire.


Don't expand your borders beyond what you can effectively control, don't overspend to the point you can never pay it off, don't hire mercs for wars, after defeating a enemy country let their own governmental structure remain but at the same time "talk" what you want them to do and remove officials you don't want while leaving the governmental structure intact, roads are important, don't outsource your military, taxing the poor to death while the rich have record low taxes is a sure fire way to fuck up your country, a non-effective legislative body is a death sentence, don't start wars you can't win, don't suppress religions cause they don't like that, diplomacy is important, economics is important.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/536420c26368723cb7750100#post_536420c26368723cb7750100
India has as many religions, gods, ethnicity, and language as they have curry mixtures since ancient times. The subcontinent was a crossroad for different trading cultures back then. Same with Southeast Asia.
The Tarim Basin in Xinjiang, Western China, is home to several archeological findings of different cultures.

"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/536420c26368723cb7750100#post_536420c26368723cb7750100
I always like how it's never "low taxes" but is "don't tax the poor, tax the rich"
topics.author: 4fe16df67f123b13e400003f

topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/536423b96368725504ae0200#post_536423b96368725504ae0200
Taxes are a pain in the ass to figure out.  Gotta pay those bills somehow, but gotta pay them even when it's a recession or depression and balance it with import taxes, business taxes and so forth.  It's like trying to balance four spinning plates all at the same time.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5364249f6368720a45bf0100#post_5364249f6368720a45bf0100
simplified tax codes are generally good.
And taxation cannot pay for the government's bills at this point. Even if they liquidated everything in the country they would not pay off the deficit.

Same with paying for services, if they liquidated everything the 1% owned it would only pay for 20 years of social services.
topics.author: 4fe16df67f123b13e400003f

topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/536427bf63687227c30f0000#post_536427bf63687227c30f0000
I think that's the one thing everyone can agree on.

I really hope that in 2016 whoever wins they'll win and their party will win enough seats that they'll finally start working on this.  At this point it's going to take decades upon decades for whoever wins to fix all the shit that has piled up the last couple of years.

To any non-usa residents wondering why the usa is so messed up here's a image that perfectly summarizes the usa:
!https://theworldaccordingtoalice.files.wordpress.com/2013/03/game-over-man-game-over.jpg!
We're pretty fucked.

topics.body:
Man, shit's going down in Ukraine.

Pro-Russian forces are shooting civilians full of bullets(a couple of the shooters were identified as part of Russian intelligence forces), using hostages, human shields, shooting down helicopters and shit.  At this point it's less about, "We want to join Russia" and more of "We'll join Russia no matter how many civilians we have to kill to do it".

Man if Russia does invade I have a feeling it's going to be cold war 2 where russia just doesn't give a shit about civilians or even their own soldiers.

It's like that call of duty level, "No Russians", but in real life.

$50 on Russia just overwhelming Ukraine forces with numbers.  They've done stuff like that before, just send a bunch of soldiers through the chopping block after saying "good luck" and after a while win anyways with numbers alone.

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5364685b636872794a620000#post_5364685b636872794a620000
The funny, in a "what were you thinking" way, is that after Russia annexed Crimea the Crimea economy is pretty much nonexistent.  Why does this matter?  If Russia does attack Ukraine, while the sanctions against Russia right now are more of a political cockfight, Russia's economy will pretty much be nonexistent afterwords due to their reliance on the stock market.  The reason why so many third world countries get away with land grabs is they do not have a stock market.  They can do whatever they want and not have to face economic repercussions, only military repercussions; Russia on the other hand has a stock market and thus if they go through with Ukraine then bye bye Russia economy.

If Russia does go to war with Ukraine the war will look like this:
"Russia has taken effective control of Ukraine"
Two weeks later
"Russia's economy has effectively collapse and the entire country's economy is nonexistent"

No offence to anyone living in Russia, but the people that are glad that the country is facing sanctions are kind of stupid.  If Russia does actually face *REAL* sanctions, and not just the for showing off kind, then bye bye Russia economy.
